channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 英国のチャンネル4は、スコットランド、ウェールズ、北アイルランドで9％の番組を制作する枠を増やすよう求めた後、イングランド以外での番組制作を増やすことを約束した（Max Goldbart/Deadline）
item.description:
Max Goldbart / Deadline:
The UK's Channel 4 commits to make more shows outside England, after calls to increase its quota to make 9% of shows in Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland  —  Channel 4 has bowed to pressure from producers and will slowly start making more shows outside of England, its boss Alex Mahon revealed today.

item.title: バイデン氏、TikTok売却法案に署名 売却か米国での禁止に向け270日のカウントダウン開始、情報筋によるとByteDanceは売却を最後の手段と見ている（Alex Barinka/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Alex Barinka / Bloomberg:
Biden signing the TikTok divestment bill starts a 270-day countdown for a sale or a US prohibition; sources say ByteDance sees divestiture as a last resort  —  - China's ByteDance faces deadline to sell app under US measure  — Company braces for legal fight against divest-or-ban efforts

item.title: Ofcom、総選挙を前に英国の放送局に公平性の重要性を警告するも、政治家をプレゼンターに起用することを全面的に禁止するには至らず（ダニエル・トーマス／フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Ofcom warns UK broadcasters on the importance of impartiality ahead of the general election, but stops short of outright banning using politicians as presenters  —  UK media regulator finds need to strengthen rules for TV channels featuring politicians as presenters

item.title: ニューズ・グループ新聞社、ザ・サン紙が公開したウェールズ王女が農産物直売所を訪れたビデオの使用でITVとITNを提訴、ITVは「強く抵抗」する方針（James Warrington/Telegraph）
item.description:
James Warrington / Telegraph:
News Group Newspapers sues ITV and ITN over using a video released by The Sun of the Princess of Wales visiting a farm shop; ITV plans to “strongly resist”  —  Broadcaster says it will ‘strongly resist’ the copyright infringement claim  —  Rupert Murdoch is suing ITV and ITN …

item.title: FTCが転職を制限する競業避止条項を禁止、企業秘密やその他の情報を守ろうとするハリウッドの雇用を複雑にする可能性（Winston Cho/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Winston Cho / The Hollywood Reporter:
The FTC bans noncompete clauses that restrict job switching, potentially complicating hiring in Hollywood as firms try to protect trade secrets and other info  —  The FTC on Tuesday voted to prohibit noncompete provisions in contracts, which could usher in a sea change to worker mobility …

item.title: NYTのデイヴィッド・マルチェーゼとルル・ガルシア＝ナヴァロが、4月27日に創刊される雑誌とポッドキャスト形式の新フランチャイズ「ザ・インタビュー」について語る（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
NYT's David Marchese and Lulu Garcia-Navarro discuss The Interview, a new franchise launching on April 27 that will appear in the Magazine and in podcast form  —  A new franchise that will appear in the Magazine and in podcast form, ‘The Interview’ will see hosts David Marchese and Lulu speak with newsmaking guests.

item.title: 米上院は79対18の大差でTikTokの投資売却法案を可決、法案はバイデン大統領に提出され、バイデン大統領は法案への署名を約束した（Lauren Feiner/The Verge）
item.description:
Lauren Feiner / The Verge:
The US Senate passes the TikTok divestment bill by a margin of 79-18; the legislation now heads to President Biden, who has committed to sign the bill into law  —  A bill that would force China-based company Bytedance to sell TikTok — or else face a US ban of the platform …

item.title: 法律学者が、TikTokの投資売却法案が憲法修正第1条の挑戦を生き残る可能性と、米国が国家安全保障の議論に頼る可能性が高い理由を議論（Casey Newton/Platformer）
item.description:
Casey Newton / Platformer:
Legal scholars discuss how the TikTok divestment bill could survive a First Amendment challenge and why the US will likely rely on a national security argument  —  The First Amendment is a major obstacle, scholars say — but it isn't insurmountable  —  On Tuesday, the Senate voted overwhelmingly …

item.title: 英CMAが懸念を表明したため、グーグルはChromeのサードパーティ・クッキーの廃止を3度目延期し、計画を2025年初頭に延期する（Seb Joseph/Digiday）
item.description:
Seb Joseph / Digiday:
For the third time, Google delays the deprecation of third-party cookies in Chrome, pushing back its plans to early 2025, after the UK CMA expressed concerns  —  Google is delaying the end of third-party cookies in its Chrome browser — again.  In other unsurprising developments, water remains wet.

item.title: AMIの元CEOデイヴィッド・ペッカーが、トランプの "目と耳 "になることに同意したことと、ナショナル・エンクワイアラーがマイケル・コーエンの催促を利用してトランプのライバルをバッシングしたことについて証言（Rolling Stone紙）
item.description:
Rolling Stone:
Ex-AMI CEO David Pecker testifies about agreeing to be Trump's “eyes and ears” and how the National Enquirer used Michael Cohen's prompts to bash Trump rivals  —  David Pecker testified about his efforts to help Trump win the White House, including by publishing bogus stories about rivals like Ted Cruz

item.title: RIAA：2023年の米国におけるラテン音楽収入は前年比16％増の14億ドル、ストリーミング総収入は17％増の13億ドル、有料サブスクリプション収入は21％増の9億1500万ドル（Isabela Raygoza/Billboard）
item.description:
Isabela Raygoza / Billboard:
RIAA: Latin music revenue in the US grew 16% YoY to $1.4B in 2023, with total streaming revenue up 17% to $1.3B and paid subscription revenue up 21% to $915M  —  Latin music revenues in the United States continue to hit an all-time high, exceeding the $1 billion mark for a second year in a row …

item.title: iHeartMediaとDeep Blue Sports + Entertainmentは、女子スポーツだけのための "史上初 "のオーディオ・プラットフォーム、Women's Sports Audio Networkの立ち上げを計画している（Erin Doherty/Axios）
item.description:
Erin Doherty / Axios:
iHeartMedia and Deep Blue Sports + Entertainment plan to launch the Women's Sports Audio Network, the “first-ever” audio platform solely for women's sports  —  - The Women's Sports Audio Network, which will be free, is set to include podcasts, sports reports and feature athletes' stories on and off the field.

item.title: アンドリュー・ニールが議会で、GBニュースは決して黒字にならず、ヘッジファンドは新聞を所有することを許されるべきではなく、スペクテイターはこれまで以上に利益を上げていると語る（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Andrew Neil tells Parliament that GB News will never be profitable, hedge funds shouldn't be allowed to own papers, and Spectator is more profitable than ever  —  The former GB News chairman says he is ‘surprised how tolerant’ Ofcom has been of the channel.

item.title: ベイエリアのNPR・PBS系列局KQEDがバイアウトを開始、レイオフや雇用凍結の可能性も（2023年、収入9,040万ドル、支出1億9,000万ドル）（Amy Graff/SFGATE
item.description:
Amy Graff / SFGATE:
KQED, a Bay Area NPR and PBS affiliate, is initiating buyouts, and may have layoffs or a hiring freeze; in 2023, revenue hit $90.4M and expenses $100.9M  —  KQED is initiating staff buyouts, an effort to reduce costs in the face of a budget deficit, SFGATE has learned.

item.title: テイラー・スウィフトの新アルバムがストリーミングの記録を塗り替えた。スポティファイによると、発売日に3億回以上のストリーミングがあり、わずか12時間で2024年で最もストリーミングされたアルバムとなった（Chris Morris/Fortune）
item.description:
Chris Morris / Fortune:
Taylor Swift's new album smashed streaming records; Spotify says it had 300M+ streams on launch day and became 2024's most-streamed album within just 12 hours  —  Never bet against Swifties.  —  Taylor Swift's loyal fan base not only sent the singer's latest album, The Tortured Poets Department …
